Kate & Leopold.plot: Kate and her actor brother live in N.Y. in the 21st Century. Her ex-boyfriend, Stuart, lives above her apartment. Stuart finds a space near the Brooklyn Bridge where there is a gap in time....
Kate & Leopold.title: Kate & Leopold

tomatoes.consensus: Though Jackman charms, Kate and Leopold is bland and predictable, and the time travel scenario lacks inner logic.

Harlan County U.S.A..plot: A filmed account of a bitterly violent miner strike.
Harlan County U.S.A..title: Harlan County U.S.A.

The Man Who Fell to Earth.plot: Thomas Jerome Newton is a humanoid alien who comes to Earth to get water for his dying planet. He starts a high technology company to get the billions of dollars he needs to build a return ...
The Man Who Fell to Earth.title: The Man Who Fell to Earth

tomatoes.consensus: Filled with stunning imagery, The Man Who Fell to Earth is a calm, meditative film that profoundly explores our culture's values and desires.

Taxi Driver.plot: A mentally unstable Vietnam war veteran works as a night-time taxi driver in New York City where the perceived decadence and sleaze feeds his urge for violent action, attempting to save a preadolescent prostitute in the process.
Taxi Driver.title: Taxi Driver

tomatoes.consensus: A must-see film for movie lovers, this Martin Scorsese masterpiece is as hard-hitting as it is compelling, with Robert De Niro at his best.

3 Women.plot: Pinky is an awkward adolescent who starts work at a spa in the California desert. She becomes overly attached to fellow spa attendant, Millie when she becomes Millie's room-mate. Mille is a...
3 Women.title: 3 Women

That Obscure Object of Desire.plot: Recounted in flashback are the romantic perils of Mathieu, a middle-aged French sophisticate as he falls for his 19-year old former chambermaid Conchita.
That Obscure Object of Desire.title: That Obscure Object of Desire

Close Encounters of the Third Kind.plot: After an encounter with U.F.O.s, a line worker feels undeniably drawn to an isolated area in the wilderness where something spectacular is about to happen.
Close Encounters of the Third Kind.title: Close Encounters of the Third Kind

tomatoes.consensus: Close Encounters' most iconic bits (the theme, the mashed-potato sculpture, etc.) have been so thoroughly absorbed into the culture that it's easy to forget that its treatment of aliens as peaceful beings rather than warmongering monsters was somewhat groundbreaking in 1977.

Grin Without a Cat.plot: French essay film focusing on global political turmoil in the 1960s and '70s, particularly the rise of the New Left in France and the development of socialist movements in Latin America.
Grin Without a Cat.title: Grin Without a Cat

Killer of Sheep.plot: Stan works in drudgery at a slaughterhouse. His personal life is drab. Dissatisfaction and ennui keep him unresponsive to the needs of his adoring wife, and he must struggle against ...
Killer of Sheep.title: Killer of Sheep

tomatoes.consensus: By turns funny, sad, and profound, Killer of Sheep offers a sympathetic and humane glimpse into inner-city life.

The Last Wave.plot: A Sydney lawyer defends five Aborigines in a ritualized taboo murder and in the process learns disturbing things about himself and premonitions.
The Last Wave.title: The Last Wave

Saturday Night Fever.plot: A Brooklyn teenager feels his only chance to succeed is as the king of the disco floor. His carefree youth and weekend dancing help him to forget the reality of his bleak life.
Saturday Night Fever.title: Saturday Night Fever

tomatoes.consensus: Boasting a smart, poignant story, a classic soundtrack, and a starmaking performance from John Travolta, Saturday Night Fever ranks among the finest dramas of the 1970s.

Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope.plot: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, a wookiee and two droids to save the universe from the Empire's world-destroying battle-station, while also attempting to rescue Princess Leia from the evil Darth Vader.
Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope.title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope

tomatoes.consensus: A legendarily expansive and ambitious start to the sci-fi saga, George Lucas opened our eyes to the possiblites of blockbuster filmmaking and things have never been the same.

Days of Heaven.plot: A hot-tempered farm laborer convinces the woman he loves to marry their rich but dying boss so that they can have a claim to his fortune.
Days of Heaven.title: Days of Heaven

The Deer Hunter.plot: An in-depth examination of the ways in which the U.S. Vietnam war impacts and disrupts the lives of people in a small industrial town in Pennsylvania.
The Deer Hunter.title: The Deer Hunter

tomatoes.consensus: Its greatness is blunted by its length and one-sided point of view, but the film's weaknesses are overpowered by Michael Cimino's sympathetic direction and a series of heartbreaking performances from Robert De Niro, Meryl Streep, and Christopher Walken.

Grease.plot: Good girl Sandy and greaser Danny fell in love over the summer. But when they unexpectedly discover they're now in the same high school, will they be able to rekindle their romance?
Grease.title: Grease

tomatoes.consensus: Grease is a pleasing, energetic musical with infectiously catchy songs and an ode to young love that never gets old.

Halloween.plot: On Halloween night of 1963, 6-year old Michael Myers stabbed his sister to death. After sitting in a mental hospital for 15 years, Myers escapes and returns to Haddonfield to kill.
Halloween.title: Halloween

tomatoes.consensus: Scary, suspenseful, and viscerally thrilling, Halloween set the standard for modern horror films.

The Last Waltz.plot: A film account and presentation of the final concert of The Band.
The Last Waltz.title: The Last Waltz

tomatoes.consensus: Among one of, if not the best rock movie ever made, The Last Waltz is a revealing, electrifying view of the classic band at their height.

Animal House.plot: At a 1962 college, Dean Vernon Wormer is determined to expel the entire Delta Tau Chi Fraternity, but those trouble-makers have other plans for him.
Animal House.title: Animal House

tomatoes.consensus: The talents of director John Landis and Saturday Night Live's irrepressible John Belushi conspired to create a rambunctious, subversive college comedy that continues to resonate.

Superman.plot: An alien orphan is sent from his dying planet to Earth, where he grows up to become his adoptive home's first and greatest superhero.
Superman.title: Superman

tomatoes.consensus: Superman deftly blends humor and gravitas, taking advantage of the perfectly cast Christopher Reeve to craft a loving, nostalgic tribute to an American pop culture icon.

Alien.plot: The commercial vessel Nostromo receives a distress call from an unexplored planet. After searching for survivors, the crew heads home only to realize that a deadly bioform has joined them.
Alien.title: Alien

tomatoes.consensus: A modern classic, Alien blends science fiction, horror and bleak poetry into a seamless whole.

Apocalypse Now.plot: During the Vietnam War, Captain Willard is sent on a dangerous mission into Cambodia to assassinate a renegade colonel who has set himself up as a god among a local tribe.
Apocalypse Now.title: Apocalypse Now

tomatoes.consensus: Francis Ford Coppola's haunting, hallucinatory Vietnam War epic is cinema at its most audacious and visionary.

The Black Stallion.plot: While traveling with his father, young Alec becomes fascinated by a mysterious Arabian stallion who is brought on board and stabled in the ship he is sailing on. When it tragically sinks ...
The Black Stallion.title: The Black Stallion

Hair.plot: Claude leaves the family ranch in Oklahoma for New York where he is rapidly indoctrinated into the youth subculture and subsequently drafted.
Hair.title: Hair

Kramer vs. Kramer.plot: Ted Kramer's wife leaves her husband, allowing for a lost bond to be rediscovered between Ted and his son, Billy. But a heated custody battle ensues over the divorced couple's son, deepening the wounds left by the separation.
Kramer vs. Kramer.title: Kramer vs. Kramer

tomatoes.consensus: The divorce subject isn't as shocking, but the film is still a thoughtful, well-acted drama that resists the urge to take sides or give easy answers.

Mad Max.plot: In a self-destructing world, a vengeful Australian policeman sets out to stop a violent motorcycle gang.
Mad Max.title: Mad Max

tomatoes.consensus: Staging the improbable car stunts and crashes to perfection, director George Miller succeeds completely in bringing the violent, post-apocalyptic world of Mad Max to visceral life.

Manhattan.plot: The life of a divorced television writer dating a teenage girl is further complicated when he falls in love with his best friend's mistress.
Manhattan.title: Manhattan

tomatoes.consensus: One of Woody Allen's early classics, Manhattan combines modern, bittersweet humor and timeless romanticism with unerring grace.

The Muppet Movie.plot: Kermit and his new found friends trek across America to find success in Hollywood, but a frog-legs merchant is after Kermit.
The Muppet Movie.title: The Muppet Movie

tomatoes.consensus: The Muppet Movie, the big-screen debut of Jim Henson's plush creations, is smart, lighthearted, and fun for all ages.

The King and the Mockingbird.plot: A chimney sweep and a shepherdess seek to escape from the clutches of a tyrannical king.
The King and the Mockingbird.title: The King and the Mockingbird

Star Trek: The Motion Picture.plot: When an alien spacecraft of enormous power is spotted approaching Earth, Admiral Kirk resumes command of the Starship Enterprise in order to intercept, examine and hopefully stop the intruder.
Star Trek: The Motion Picture.title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture

The Big Red One.plot: The story of a sergeant and the inner core members of his unit as they try to serve in and survive World War II.
The Big Red One.title: The Big Red One

tomatoes.consensus: The reconstruction of Samuel Fuller's epic account of his days in North Africa in World War II elevates the film into the pantheon of great war movies.

Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strike.plot: After the rebels have been brutally overpowered by the Empire on their newly established base, Luke Skywalker takes advanced Jedi training with Master Yoda, while his friends are pursued by Darth Vader as part of his plan to capture Luke.
Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strike.title: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back

tomatoes.consensus: Dark, sinister, but ultimately even more involving than A New Hope, The Empire Strikes Back defies viewer expectations and takes the series to heightened emotional levels.

Flash Gordon.plot: A football player and his friends travel to the planet Mongo and find themselves fighting the tyranny of Ming the Merciless to save Earth.
Flash Gordon.title: Flash Gordon

tomatoes.consensus: Campy charm and a knowing sense of humor help to overcome a silly plot involving a spacefaring ex-football player, his adoring bevy of groupies, and a supervillain named Ming the Merciless.

Friday the 13th.plot: A group of camp counselors is stalked and murdered by an unknown assailant while trying to reopen a summer camp which, years before, was the site of a child's drowning.
Friday the 13th.title: Friday the 13th

Ordinary People.plot: The accidental death of the older son of an affluent family deeply strains the relationships among the bitter mother, the good-natured father, and the guilt-ridden younger son.
Ordinary People.title: Ordinary People

tomatoes.consensus: Though shot through with bitterness and sorrow, Robert Redford's directorial debut is absorbing and well-acted.

Popeye.plot: The adventures of the sailor man and his friends in the seaside town of Sweethaven.
Popeye.title: Popeye

tomatoes.consensus: Altman's take on the iconic cartoon is messy and wildly uneven, but its robust humor and manic charm are hard to resist.

Raging Bull.plot: An emotionally self-destructive boxer's journey through life, as the violence and temper that leads him to the top in the ring, destroys his life outside it.
Raging Bull.title: Raging Bull

tomatoes.consensus: Arguably Martin Scorsese's and Robert De Niro's finest film, Raging Bull is often painful to watch, but it's a searing, powerful work about an unsympathetic hero.

Scanners.plot: A scientist sends a man with extraordinary psychic powers to hunt others like him.
Scanners.title: Scanners

The Shining.plot: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where an evil and spiritual presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from the past and of the future.
The Shining.title: The Shining

tomatoes.consensus: Though it deviates from Stephen King's novel, Stanley Kubrick's The Shining is a chilling, often baroque journey into madness -- exemplified by an unforgettable turn from Jack Nicholson

Somewhere in Time.plot: A Chicago playwright uses self-hypnosis to find the actress whose vintage portrait hangs in a grand hotel.
Somewhere in Time.title: Somewhere in Time

Stir Crazy.plot: Skip and Harry are framed for a bank robbery and end up in a western prison. The two eastern boys are having difficulty adjusting to the new life until the warden finds that Skip has a ...
Stir Crazy.title: Stir Crazy

Superman II.plot: Superman agrees to sacrifice his powers to start a relationship with Lois Lane, unaware that three Kryptonian criminals he inadvertently released are conquering Earth.
Superman II.title: Superman II

tomatoes.consensus: The humor occasionally stumbles into slapstick territory, and the special effects are dated, but Superman II meets, if not exceeds, the standard set by its predecessor.

Xanadu.plot: The story of a girl who makes dreams come true.
Xanadu.title: Xanadu

An American Werewolf in London.plot: Two American college students on a walking tour of Britain are attacked by a werewolf that none of the locals will admit exists.
An American Werewolf in London.title: An American Werewolf in London

tomatoes.consensus: Terrifying and funny in almost equal measure, John Landis' horror-comedy crosses genres while introducing Rick Baker's astounding make-up effects.

Body Heat.plot: In the midst of a searing Florida heat wave, a woman convinces her lover, a small-town lawyer, to murder her rich husband.
Body Heat.title: Body Heat

Das Boot.plot: The claustrophobic world of a WWII German U-boat; boredom, filth, and sheer terror.
Das Boot.title: Das Boot

tomatoes.consensus: Taut, breathtakingly thrilling, and devastatingly intelligent, Das Boot is one of the greatest war films ever made.

Conan the Barbarian.plot: A vengeful barbarian warrior sets off to avenge his tribe and his parents whom were slain by an evil sorcerer and his warriors when he was a boy.
Conan the Barbarian.title: Conan the Barbarian

tomatoes.consensus: Though Conan may take itself too seriously for some, this adventure film about a former slave seeking vengeance is full of quotable Schwarzenegger lines and gritty action.

Gallipoli.plot: Two Australian sprinters face the brutal realities of war when they are sent to fight in the Gallipoli campaign in Turkey during World War I.
Gallipoli.title: Gallipoli

tomatoes.consensus: Peter Weir's devastating anti-war film features a low-key but emotionally wrenching performance from Mel Gibson as a young soldier fighting in one of World War I's most deadly and horrifying battles.

Halloween II.plot: While Sheriff Brackett and Dr. Loomis hunt for Michael Myers, a traumatized Laurie is rushed to hospital, and the serial killer is not far behind her.
Halloween II.title: Halloween II

Mad Max 2: The Road Warrior.plot: In the post-apocalyptic Australian wasteland, a cynical drifter agrees to help a small, gasoline rich, community escape a band of bandits.
Mad Max 2: The Road Warrior.title: Mad Max 2: The Road Warrior

tomatoes.consensus: The Road Warrior is everything a bigger-budgeted Mad Max sequel with should be: bigger, faster, louder, but definitely not dumber.

Ms .45.plot: A shy and mute seamstress goes insane after being attacked and raped twice in one day, in which she takes to the streets of New York after dark and randomly kills men with a .45 caliber gun.
Ms .45.title: Ms .45

Ragtime.plot: A young black pianist becomes embroiled in the lives of an upper-class white family set among the racial tensions, infidelity, violence, and other nostalgic events in early 1900s New York City.
Ragtime.title: Ragtime

Raiders of the Lost Ark.plot: Archaeologist and adventurer Indiana Jones is hired by the US government to find the Ark of the Covenant before the Nazis.
Raiders of the Lost Ark.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark

tomatoes.consensus: Featuring bravura set pieces, sly humor, and white-knuckle action, Raiders of the Lost Ark is one of the most consummately entertaining adventure pictures of all time.

Thief.plot: Becoming closer to his dream of leading a normal life, a professional safecracker agrees to do a job for the mafia, who have other plans for him.
Thief.title: Thief

48 Hrs..plot: A hard-nosed cop reluctantly teams up with a wise-cracking criminal temporarily paroled to him, in order to track down a killer.
48 Hrs..title: 48 Hrs.

tomatoes.consensus: Marking an auspicious feature film debut for Eddie Murphy, 48 Hrs. is a briskly paced action comedy that succeeds largely due to the outstanding chemistry between its two leads.

Annie.plot: A young orphan girl's adventures in finding a family that will take her.
Annie.title: Annie

tomatoes.consensus: John Huston proves an odd choice to direct, miring Annie in a sluggish, stagebound mess of an adaptation, but the kids are cute and the songs are memorable.

The Beastmaster.plot: A sword-and-sorcery fantasy about a young man's search for revenge. Armed with supernatural powers, the handsome hero and his animal allies wage war against marauding forces.
The Beastmaster.title: The Beastmaster

Blade Runner.plot: A blade runner must pursue and try to terminate four replicants who stole a ship in space and have returned to Earth to find their creator.
Blade Runner.title: Blade Runner

tomatoes.consensus: Misunderstood when it first hit theaters, the influence of Ridley Scott's mysterious, neo-noir Blade Runner has deepened with time. A visually remarkable, achingly human sci-fi masterpiece.

Deathtrap.plot: A Broadway playwright puts murder in his plan to take credit for a student's script.
Deathtrap.title: Deathtrap

Diner.plot: A group of college-age buddies struggle with their imminent passage into adulthood in 1959 Baltimore.
Diner.title: Diner

E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial.plot: A troubled child summons the courage to help a friendly alien escape Earth and return to his home-world.
E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial.title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial

tomatoes.consensus: Playing as both an exciting sci-fi adventure and a remarkable portrait of childhood, Steven Spielberg's touching tale of a homesick alien remains a piece of movie magic for young and old.

The Evil Dead.plot: Five friends travel to a cabin in the woods, where they unknowingly release flesh-possessing demons.
The Evil Dead.title: The Evil Dead

tomatoes.consensus: This classic low budget horror film combines just the right amount of gore and black humor, giving The Evil Dead an equal amount of thrills and laughs.

Fast Times at Ridgemont High.plot: A group of Southern California high school students are enjoying their most important subjects: sex, drugs and rock n' roll.
Fast Times at Ridgemont High.title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High

tomatoes.consensus: While Fast Times at Ridgemont High features Sean Penn's legendary performance, the film endures because it accurately captured the small details of school, work, and teenage life.

Fanny and Alexander.plot: Two young Swedish children experience the many comedies and tragedies of their family, the Ekdahls.
Fanny and Alexander.title: Fanny and Alexander

First Blood.plot: A Vietnam Veteran uses his combat skills against the lawman of a small town when they arrest and abuse him.
First Blood.title: First Blood

tomatoes.consensus: A much darker, more sensitive film than the sequels it spawned, First Blood is a thrilling survival adventure, and the role of haunted Vietnam vet John Rambo takes full advantage of Sylvester Stallone's acting skills.

An Officer and a Gentleman.plot: A young man must complete his work at a Navy Flight school to become an aviator, with the help of a tough gunnery sergeant and his new girlfriend.
An Officer and a Gentleman.title: An Officer and a Gentleman

tomatoes.consensus: Old-fashioned without sacrificing its characters to simplicity, An Officer and a Gentleman successfully walks the fine line between sweeping romance and melodrama.

Poltergeist.plot: A family's home is haunted by a host of ghosts.
Poltergeist.title: Poltergeist

tomatoes.consensus: Smartly filmed, tightly scripted, and -- most importantly -- consistently frightening, Poltergeist is a modern horror classic.

Porky's.plot: Set in 1954, a group of Florida high schoolers seek out to help a buddy lose his virginity, which leads them to seek revenge on a sleazy nightclub owner and his redneck sheriff brother for harassing them.
Porky's.title: Porky's

Sophie's Choice.plot: A mother has to make a very difficult decision.
Sophie's Choice.title: Sophie's Choice

Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan.plot: With the assistance of the Enterprise crew, Admiral Kirk must stop an old nemesis, Khan Noonien Singh, from using a life-generating device, the Genesis Device, as the ultimate weapon.
Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan.title: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan

tomatoes.consensus: Considered by many fans to be the best of the Star Trek movies, Khan features a strong plot, increased tension, and a sharp supporting performance from Ricardo Montalban.

Tootsie.plot: Michael Dorsey, an unsuccessful actor disguises himself as a woman in order to get a role on a trashy hospital soap.
Tootsie.title: Tootsie

The Big Chill.plot: A group of seven former college friends gather for a weekend reunion at a South Carolina winter house after the funeral of one of their friends.
The Big Chill.title: The Big Chill

A Christmas Story.plot: Ralphie has to convince his parents, his teacher, and Santa that a Red Ryder B.B. gun really is the perfect gift for the 1940s.
A Christmas Story.title: A Christmas Story

tomatoes.consensus: Both warmly nostalgic and darkly humorous, A Christmas Story deserves its status as a holiday perennial.

The Dead Zone.plot: A man awakens from a coma to discover he has a psychic detective ability.
The Dead Zone.title: The Dead Zone

tomatoes.consensus: The Dead Zone combines taut direction from David Cronenberg and and a rich performance from Christopher Walken to create one of the strongest Stephen King adaptations.

Educating Rita.plot: A young wife decides to complete her education and take her exams. She meets a professor who teaches her to value her own insights while still being able to beat the exams. The change in ...
Educating Rita.title: Educating Rita

El Norte.plot: Peasants escaping mindless labor and a murderous Guatemalan government head to America in hopes for something better.
El Norte.title: El Norte

Flashdance.plot: A Pittsburgh woman with two jobs as a welder and an exotic dancer wants to get into ballet school.
Flashdance.title: Flashdance

tomatoes.consensus: All style and very little substance, Flashdance boasts eye-catching dance sequences -- and benefits from an appealing performance from Jennifer Beals -- but its narrative is flat-footed.

The Keep.plot: Nazis are forced to turn to a Jewish historian for help in battling the ancient demon they have inadvertently freed from its prison.
The Keep.title: The Keep

The Outsiders.plot: The rivalry between two gangs, the poor Greasers and the rich Socs, only heats up when one gang member kills a member of the other.
The Outsiders.title: The Outsiders

Phar Lap.plot: The true story of a Australian racehorse that becomes a champion with the help of a local stableboy.
Phar Lap.title: Phar Lap

Baby Boom.plot: The life of super-yuppie J.C. is thrown into turmoil when she inherits a baby from a distant relative.
Baby Boom.title: Baby Boom

Beverly Hills Cop II.plot: Axel Foley returns to Beverly Hills to help Taggart and Rosewood investigate Chief Bogamil's near-fatal shooting and the series of "alphabet crimes" associated with it.
Beverly Hills Cop II.title: Beverly Hills Cop II

tomatoes.consensus: Eddie Murphy remains appealing as the wisecracking Axel Foley, but Beverly Hills Cop II doesn't take him -- or the viewer -- anywhere new enough to justify a sequel.

The Big Easy.plot: Set in New Orleans. Remy McSwain, lieutenant in Homicide finds that he has two problems, the first of a series of gang killings and Ann Osborne, a beautiful attorney from the D.A.'s police ...
The Big Easy.title: The Big Easy

tomatoes.consensus: Loaded with atmosphere and drenched in the sizzling chemistry between Dennis Quaid and Ellen Barkin, The Big Easy remains one of the strongest -- and steamiest -- thrillers of the 1980s.

Broadcast News.plot: Take two rival TV reporters: one handsome, one talented, both male. Add one producer, female. Mix well and watch the sparks fly.
Broadcast News.title: Broadcast News

Dirty Dancing.plot: Spending the summer in a holiday camp with her family, Frances "Baby" Houseman falls in love with the camp's dance instructor Johnny Castle.
Dirty Dancing.title: Dirty Dancing

Epidemic.plot: A film director and a script writer (performed by Lars von Trier and Niels Vèrsel themselves) write a screenplay, in which an epidemic spreads about the whole world. Like the protagonist ...
Epidemic.title: Epidemic

Empire of the Sun.plot: A young English boy struggles to survive under Japanese occupation during World War II.
Empire of the Sun.title: Empire of the Sun

tomatoes.consensus: One of Steven Spielberg's most ambitious efforts of the 1980s, Empire of the Sun remains an underrated gem in the director's distinguished filmography.

Evil Dead II.plot: The lone survivor of an onslaught of flesh-possessing spirits holds up in a cabin with a group of strangers while the demons continue their attack.
Evil Dead II.title: Evil Dead II

tomatoes.consensus: Evil Dead 2's increased special effects and slapstick-gore makes it as good -- if not better -- than the original.

Fatal Attraction.plot: A married man's one night stand comes back to haunt him when that lover begins to stalk him and his family.
Fatal Attraction.title: Fatal Attraction

tomatoes.consensus: A potboiler in the finest sense, Fatal Attraction is a sultry, juicy thriller that's hard to look away from once it gets going.

Full Metal Jacket.plot: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the U.S.-Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.
Full Metal Jacket.title: Full Metal Jacket

tomatoes.consensus: Intense, tightly constructed, and darkly comic at times, Stanley Kubrick's Full Metal Jacket may not boast the most original of themes, but it is exceedingly effective at communicating them.

Harry and the Hendersons.plot: Returning from a hunting trip in the forest, the Henderson family's car hits an animal in the road. At first they fear it was a man, but when they examine the "body" they find it's a "...
Harry and the Hendersons.title: Harry and the Hendersons

Wings of Desire.plot: An angel tires of overseeing human activity and wishes to become human when he falls in love with a mortal.
Wings of Desire.title: Wings of Desire

Ishtar.plot: Two terrible lounge singers get booked to play a gig in a Moroccan hotel but somehow become pawns in an international power play between the CIA, the Emir of Ishtar, and the rebels trying to overthrow his regime.
Ishtar.title: Ishtar

The Last Emperor.plot: The story of the final Emperor of China.
The Last Emperor.title: The Last Emperor

tomatoes.consensus: While decidedly imperfect, Bernardo Bertolucci's epic is still a feast for the eyes.

Lethal Weapon.plot: A veteran cop, Murtaugh, is partnered with a young suicidal cop, Riggs. Both having one thing in common; hating working in pairs. Now they must learn to work with one another to stop a gang of drug smugglers.
Lethal Weapon.title: Lethal Weapon

tomatoes.consensus: The most successful installment in a phenomenally successful series, Lethal Weapon helped redefine action movies for the 1980s and 1990s.

The Lost Boys.plot: After moving to a new town, two brothers are convinced that the area is frequented by vampires.
The Lost Boys.title: The Lost Boys

tomatoes.consensus: Flawed but eminently watchable, Joel Schumacher's teen vampire thriller blends horror, humor, and plenty of visual style with standout performances from a cast full of young 1980s stars.

Maurice.plot: After his lover rejects him, a young man trapped by the oppressiveness of Edwardian society tries to come to terms with and accept his sexuality.
Maurice.title: Maurice

Moonstruck.plot: Loretta Castorini, a book keeper from Brooklyn, New York, finds herself in a difficult situation when she falls for the brother of the man she agreed to marry (the best friend of her late husband who died seven years previously).
Moonstruck.title: Moonstruck

tomatoes.consensus: Led by energetic performances from Nicolas Cage and Cher, Moonstruck is an exuberantly funny tribute to love and one of the decade's most appealing comedies.

Predator.plot: A team of commandos on a mission in a Central American jungle find themselves hunted by an extra-terrestrial warrior.
Predator.title: Predator

Prince of Darkness.plot: A research team finds a mysterious cylinder in a deserted church. If opened, it could mean the end of the world.
Prince of Darkness.title: Prince of Darkness

The Princess Bride.plot: While home sick in bed, a young boy's grandfather reads him a story called The Princess Bride.
The Princess Bride.title: The Princess Bride

tomatoes.consensus: A delightfully postmodern fairy tale, The Princess Bride is a deft, intelligent mix of swashbuckling, romance, and comedy that takes an age-old damsel-in-distress story and makes it fresh.

Raising Arizona.plot: When a childless couple of an ex-con and an ex-cop decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintupelets, their lives get more complicated than they anticipated.
Raising Arizona.title: Raising Arizona

tomatoes.consensus: A terrifically original, eccentric screwball comedy, Raising Arizona may not be the Coens' most disciplined movie, but it's one of their most purely entertaining.

RoboCop.plot: In a dystopic and crime-ridden Detroit, a terminally wounded cop returns to the force as a powerful cyborg haunted by submerged memories.
RoboCop.title: RoboCop

tomatoes.consensus: While over-the-top and gory, Robocop is also a surprisingly smart sci-fi flick that uses ultraviolence to disguise its satire of American culture.

Spaceballs.plot: Planet Spaceball's President Skroob sends Lord Dark Helmet to steal Planet Druidia's abundant supply of air to replenish their own, and only Lone Starr can stop them.
Spaceballs.title: Spaceballs

Some Kind of Wonderful.plot: A young tomboy, Watts, finds her feelings for her best friend, Keith, run deeper than just friendship when he gets a date with the most popular girl in school. Unfortunately, the girl's old...
Some Kind of Wonderful.title: Some Kind of Wonderful

Superman IV: The Quest for Peace.plot: The Man of Steel crusades for nuclear disarmament and meets Lex Luthor's latest creation, Nuclear Man.
Superman IV: The Quest for Peace.title: Superman IV: The Quest for Peace

tomatoes.consensus: The Superman series bottoms out here: the action is boring, the special effects look cheaper, and none of the actors appear interested in where the plot's going.

Swimming to Cambodia.plot: Spalding Gray tells about his participation in the film, "The Killing Fields" & the background story about the troubles of Cambodia.
Swimming to Cambodia.title: Swimming to Cambodia

The Untouchables.plot: Federal Agent Eliot Ness sets out to stop Al Capone; because of rampant corruption, he assembles a small, hand-picked team.
The Untouchables.title: The Untouchables

tomatoes.consensus: Slick on the surface but loaded with artful touches, Brian DePalma's classical gangster thriller is a sharp look at period Chicago crime, featuring excellent performances from a top-notch cast.

Wall Street.plot: A young and impatient stockbroker is willing to do anything to get to the top, including trading on illegal inside information taken through a ruthless and greedy corporate raider who takes the youth under his wing.
Wall Street.title: Wall Street

The Witches of Eastwick.plot: Three single women in a picturesque village have their wishes granted - at a cost - when a mysterious and flamboyant man arrives in their lives.
The Witches of Eastwick.title: The Witches of Eastwick

tomatoes.consensus: A wickedly funny tale of three witches and their duel with the Devil, fuelled by some delicious fantasy and arch comedic performances.

The Accidental Tourist.plot: An emotionally distant writer of travel guides must carry on with his life after his son is killed and his marriage crumbles.
The Accidental Tourist.title: The Accidental Tourist

Akira.plot: A secret military project endangers Neo-Tokyo when it turns a biker gang member into a rampaging psionic psychopath that only two kids and a group of psionics can stop.
Akira.title: Akira

tomatoes.consensus: Akira is distractingly bloody and violent, but its phenomenal animation and sheer kinetic energy helped set the standard for modern anime.

Alien Nation.plot: A few years from now, Earth will have the first contact with an alien civilization. These aliens, known as Newcomers, slowly begin to be integrated into human society after years of quarantine.
Alien Nation.title: Alien Nation

tomatoes.consensus: Alien Nation takes the interesting premise of extraterrestrials living among us and doesn't do enough with it, emphasizing a police procedural plotline over the more intriguing sci-fi elements.

Beetlejuice.plot: A couple of recently deceased ghosts contract the services of a "bio-exorcist" in order to remove the obnoxious new owners of their house.
Beetlejuice.title: Beetlejuice

tomatoes.consensus: Brilliantly bizarre and overflowing with ideas, Beetlejuice offers some of Michael Keaton's most deliciously manic work - and creepy, funny fun for the whole family.

Big.plot: When a boy wishes to be big at a magic wish machine, he wakes up the next morning and finds himself in an adult body.
Big.title: Big

tomatoes.consensus: Refreshingly sweet and undeniably funny, Big is a showcase for Tom Hanks, who dives into his role and infuses it with charm and surprising poignancy.

Bird.plot: The troubled life and career of the jazz musician, Charlie "Bird" Parker.
Bird.title: Bird

Bull Durham.plot: A fan who has an affair with one minor-league baseball player each season meets an up-and-coming pitcher and the experienced catcher assigned to him.
Bull Durham.title: Bull Durham

tomatoes.consensus: Kevin Costner at his funniest and most charismatic in Bull Durham, a film that's as wise about relationships as it is about minor league baseball.

Cobra Verde.plot: The feared bandit Cobra Verde (Klaus Kinski) is hired by a plantation owner to supervise his slaves. After the owner suspects Cobra Verde of consorting with his young daughters, the owner ...
Cobra Verde.title: Cobra Verde

Cocktail.plot: A talented New York bartender takes a job at a bar in Jamaica and falls in love.
Cocktail.title: Cocktail

tomatoes.consensus: There are no surprises in Cocktail, a shallow, dramatically inert romance that squanders Tom Cruise's talents in what amounts to a naive barkeep's banal fantasy.

Colors.plot: An experienced cop and his rookie partner patrol the streets of East Los Angeles while trying to keep the gang violence under control.
Colors.title: Colors

Coming to America.plot: An African prince goes to Queens, New York City to find a wife whom he can respect for her intelligence and will.
Coming to America.title: Coming to America

Dangerous Liaisons.plot: Rich and bored aristocrats in Rococo France play high-stakes games of passion and betrayal.
Dangerous Liaisons.title: Dangerous Liaisons

tomatoes.consensus: Stylish, seductive, and clever, Stephen Frears' adaptation is a wickedly entertaining exploration of sexual politics.

Dead Ringers.plot: Twin gynecologists take full advantage of the fact that nobody can tell them apart, until their relationship begins to deteriorate over a woman.
Dead Ringers.title: Dead Ringers

Dirty Rotten Scoundrels.plot: Two con men try to settle their rivalry by betting on who can swindle a young American heiress out of $50,000 first.
Dirty Rotten Scoundrels.title: Dirty Rotten Scoundrels

tomatoes.consensus: A buoyant, clever update of the conman flick Bedtime Story, with plenty of comedic jousting resulting from a winning chemistry between Michael Caine and Steve Martin.

Die Hard.plot: John McClane, officer of the NYPD, tries to save wife Holly Gennaro and several others, taken hostage by German terrorist Hans Gruber during a Christmas party at the Nakatomi Plaza in Los Angeles.
Die Hard.title: Die Hard

tomatoes.consensus: Its many imitators (and sequels) have never come close to matching the taut thrills of the definitive holiday action classic.

A Fish Called Wanda.plot: In London, four very different people team up to commit armed robbery, then try to doublecross each other for the loot.
A Fish Called Wanda.title: A Fish Called Wanda

tomatoes.consensus: Smartly written, smoothly directed, and solidly cast, A Fish Called Wanda offers a classic example of a brainy comedy with widespread appeal.

The Big Blue.plot: Enzo and Jacques have known each other for a long time. Their friendship started in their childhood days in the Mediterranean. They were not real friends in these days, but there was ...
The Big Blue.title: The Big Blue

tomatoes.consensus: Though this movie features beautiful cinematography, it drags on, being way too overblown and melodramatic.

Hairspray.plot: A 'pleasantly plump' teenager teaches 1962 Baltimore a thing or two about integration after landing a spot on a local TV dance show.
Hairspray.title: Hairspray

tomatoes.consensus: Hairspray is perhaps John Waters' most accessible film, and as such, it's a gently subversive slice of retro hilarity.

Halloween 4: The Return of Michael Myers.plot: Ten years after his original massacre, the invalid Michael Myers awakens and returns to Haddonfield to kill his seven-year-old niece on Halloween. Can Dr. Loomis stop him?
Halloween 4: The Return of Michael Myers.title: Halloween 4: The Return of Michael Myers

High Hopes.plot: Slice-of-life look at a sweet working-class couple in London, Shirley and Cyril, his mother, who's aging quickly and becoming forgetful, mum's ghastly upper-middle-class neighbors, and ...
High Hopes.title: High Hopes

The Last Temptation of Christ.plot: The life of Jesus Christ, his journey through life as he faces the struggles all humans do, and his final temptation on the cross.
The Last Temptation of Christ.title: The Last Temptation of Christ

Let's Get Lost.plot: Documentary on the life of jazz trumpeter and drug addict Chet Baker. Fascinating series of interviews with friends, family, associates and lovers, interspersed with film from Baker's ...
Let's Get Lost.title: Let's Get Lost

Married to the Mob.plot: An undercover FBI agent falls in love with a recently widowed mafia wife seeking to start her life over after her husband's murder and who is also pursued by a libidinous mafia kingpin seeking to claim her for himself.
Married to the Mob.title: Married to the Mob

Midnight Run.plot: An accountant is chased by bounty hunters, the FBI, and the Mafia after jumping bail.
Midnight Run.title: Midnight Run

tomatoes.consensus: Enlivened by the antagonistic chemistry between Robert De Niro and Charles Grodin, Midnight Run is an uncommonly entertaining odd couple comedy.

Mississippi Burning.plot: Two FBI agents with wildly different styles arrive in Mississippi to investigate the disappearance of some civil rights activists.
Mississippi Burning.title: Mississippi Burning

Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdow.plot: A woman's lover leaves her, and she tries to contact him to find out why he's left. She confronts his wife and son, who are as clueless as she. Meanwhile her girlfriend is afraid the police...
Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdow.title: Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown

Mystic Pizza.plot: Three teenage girls come of age while working at a pizza parlor in the Connecticut town of Mystic.
Mystic Pizza.title: Mystic Pizza

tomatoes.consensus: The Naked Gun is chock full of gags that are goofy, unapologetically crass, and ultimately hilarious.

Cinema Paradiso.plot: A filmmaker recalls his childhood, when he fell in love with the movies at his village's theater and formed a deep friendship with the theater's projectionist.
Cinema Paradiso.title: Cinema Paradiso

Bagdad Cafe.plot: A lonely German woman ends up in the most desolate motel on Earth and decides to make it brighter.
Bagdad Cafe.title: Bagdad Cafe

Rain Man.plot: Selfish yuppie Charlie Babbitt's father left a fortune to his savant brother Raymond and a pittance to Charlie; they travel cross-country.
Rain Man.title: Rain Man

tomatoes.consensus: This road-trip movie about an autistic savant and his callow brother is far from seamless, but Barry Levinson's direction is impressive, and strong performances from Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman add to its appeal.

Rambo III.plot: Rambo's Vietnam commanding officer Colonel Trautman is held hostage in Afghanistan, and it's up to Rambo to rescue him.
Rambo III.title: Rambo III

Salaam Bombay!.plot: The boy Krishna is abandoned by his mother at the Apollo Circus and she tells him that he can only return home when he can afford 500 rupees to pay for the bicycle of his brother that he ...
Salaam Bombay!.title: Salaam Bombay!

Scrooged.plot: A selfish, cynical T.V. executive is haunted by three spirits bearing lessons on Christmas Eve.
Scrooged.title: Scrooged

Tequila Sunrise.plot: Mac Mckussic is an unlikely drug dealer who wants to go straight. His old and best friend Nick Frescia is now a cop who is assigned to investigate and bring him to justice. Mac is very ...
Tequila Sunrise.title: Tequila Sunrise

The Thin Blue Line.plot: A film that successfully argued that a man was wrongly convicted for murder by a corrupt justice system in Dallas County, Texas.
The Thin Blue Line.title: The Thin Blue Line

They Live.plot: A drifter discovers a pair of sunglasses that allow him to wake up to the fact that aliens have taken over the Earth.
They Live.title: They Live

tomatoes.consensus: A politically subversive blend of horror and sci fi, They Live is an underrated genre film from John Carpenter.

Twins.plot: A physically perfect but innocent man goes in search of his long-lost twin brother, who is a short small-time crook.
Twins.title: Twins

Tucker: The Man and His Dream.plot: The story of Preston Tucker, the maverick car designer and his ill-fated challenge to the auto industry with his revolutionary car concept.
Tucker: The Man and His Dream.title: Tucker: The Man and His Dream

tomatoes.consensus: Though it may not be as comprehensive as some would like, Francis Ford Coppola's cheerful biopic of the failed automotive designer features sparkling direction and a strong central performance from Jeff Bridges.

Who Framed Roger Rabbit.plot: A toon hating detective is a cartoon rabbit's only hope to prove his innocence when he is accused of murder.
Who Framed Roger Rabbit.title: Who Framed Roger Rabbit

tomatoes.consensus: Who Framed Roger Rabbit is an innovative and entertaining film that features a groundbreaking mix of live action and animation, with a touching and original story to boot.

Working Girl.plot: When a secretary's idea is stolen by her boss, she seizes an opportunity to steal it back by pretending she has her boss's job.
Working Girl.title: Working Girl

Young Guns.plot: A group of young gunmen, led by Billy the Kid, become deputies to avenge the murder of the rancher who became their benefactor. But when Billy takes their authority too far, they become the hunted.
Young Guns.title: Young Guns

The Adventures of Baron Munchausen.plot: An account of Baron Munchausen's supposed travels and fantastical experiences with his band of misfits.
The Adventures of Baron Munchausen.title: The Adventures of Baron Munchausen

tomatoes.consensus: Bursting with Terry Gilliam's typically imaginative flourishes, this story of a possibly deranged Baron recounting his storied life is a flamboyant and witty visual treat.

The Abyss.plot: A civilian diving team is enlisted to search for a lost nuclear submarine and face danger while encountering an alien aquatic species.
The Abyss.title: The Abyss

tomatoes.consensus: The utterly gorgeous special effects frequently overshadow the fact that The Abyss is also a totally gripping, claustrophobic thriller, complete with an interesting crew of characters.

All Dogs Go to Heaven.plot: A dog returns from the dead looking for revenge on his killer using an orphan girl who can talk to animals.
All Dogs Go to Heaven.title: All Dogs Go to Heaven

Always.plot: A romantic adventure about a legendary pilot's passion for dare-devil firefighting and his girl.
Always.title: Always

Back to the Future Part II.plot: After visiting 2015, Marty McFly must repeat his visit to 1955 to prevent disastrous changes to 1985... without interfering with his first trip.
Back to the Future Part II.title: Back to the Future Part II

tomatoes.consensus: Back to the Future II is far more uneven than its predecessor, but its madcap highs outweigh the occasionally cluttered machinations of an overstuffed plot.

Batman.plot: The Dark Knight of Gotham City begins his war on crime with his first major enemy being the clownishly homicidal Joker.
Batman.title: Batman

tomatoes.consensus: An eerie, haunting spectacle, Batman succeeds as dark entertainment, even if Jack Nicholson's Joker too often overshadows the title character.

Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure.plot: Two seemingly dumb teens struggle to prepare a historical presentation with the help of a time machine.
Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure.title: Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure

tomatoes.consensus: Keanu Reeves and Alex Winter are just charming, goofy, and silly enough to make this fluffy time-travel Adventure work.

Born on the Fourth of July.plot: The biography of Ron Kovic. Paralyzed in the Vietnam war, he becomes an anti-war and pro-human rights political activist after feeling betrayed by the country he fought for.
Born on the Fourth of July.title: Born on the Fourth of July

tomatoes.consensus: Led by an unforgettable performance from Tom Cruise, Born on the Fourth of July finds director Oliver Stone tackling thought-provoking subject matter with ambitious èlan.

Crimes and Misdemeanors.plot: An ophthalmologist's mistress threatens to reveal their affair to his wife, while a married documentary filmmaker is infatuated by another woman.
Crimes and Misdemeanors.title: Crimes and Misdemeanors

Dead Poets Society.plot: English teacher John Keating inspires his students to discover their love for poetry and seize the day.
Dead Poets Society.title: Dead Poets Society

tomatoes.consensus: Affecting performances from the young cast and a genuinely inspirational turn from Robin Williams grant Peter Weir's prep school drama top honors.

Do the Right Thing.plot: On the hottest day of the year on a street in the Bedford-Stuyvesant section of Brooklyn, everyone's hate and bigotry smolders and builds until it explodes into violence.
Do the Right Thing.title: Do the Right Thing

tomatoes.consensus: Smart, vibrant, and urgent without being didactic, Do the Right Thing is one of Spike Lee's most fully realized efforts -- and one of the most important films of the 1980s.

Drugstore Cowboy.plot: A pharmacy-robbing dope fiend and his crew pop pills and evade the law.
Drugstore Cowboy.title: Drugstore Cowboy

Driving Miss Daisy.plot: An old Jewish woman and her African-American chauffeur in the American South have a relationship that grows and improves over the years.
Driving Miss Daisy.title: Driving Miss Daisy

tomatoes.consensus: Warm and smartly paced, and boasting impeccable performances from Morgan Freeman and Jessica Tandy.

Field of Dreams.plot: An Iowa corn farmer, hearing voices, interprets them as a command to build a baseball diamond in his fields; he does, and the Chicago White Sox come.
Field of Dreams.title: Field of Dreams

tomatoes.consensus: Field of Dreams is sentimental, but in the best way; it's a mix of fairy tale, baseball, and family togetherness.

Ghostbusters II.plot: The discovery of a massive river of ectoplasm and a resurgence of spectral activity allows the staff of Ghostbusters to revive the business.
Ghostbusters II.title: Ghostbusters II

tomatoes.consensus: Thanks to the cast, Ghostbusters 2 is reasonably amusing, but it lacks the charm, wit, and energy of its predecessor.

Harlem Nights.plot: "Sugar" Ray is the owner of an illegal casino, who contend with the pressures of vicious gangster and corrupt policemen who want to see him go out of business. In the world of organized ...
Harlem Nights.title: Harlem Nights

Heathers.plot: A girl who half-heartedly tries to be part of the "in crowd" of her school meets a rebel who teaches her a more devious way to play social politics; killing the popular kids.
Heathers.title: Heathers

tomatoes.consensus: Dark, cynical, and subversive, Heathers gently applies a chainsaw to the conventions of the high school movie -- changing the game for teen comedies to follow.

Henry V.plot: The gritty adaption of William Shakespeare's play about the English King's bloody conquest of France.
Henry V.title: Henry V

tomatoes.consensus: Pehaps Kenneth Branagh's most fully realized Shakespeare adaptation, Henry V is an energetic, passionate, and wonderfully acted film.

Honey, I Shrunk the Kids.plot: The scientist father of a teenage girl and boy accidentally shrinks his and two other neighborhood teens to the size of insects. Now the teens must fight diminutive dangers as the father searches for them.
Honey, I Shrunk the Kids.title: Honey, I Shrunk the Kids

Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade.plot: When Dr. Henry Jones Sr. suddenly goes missing while pursuing the Holy Grail, eminent archaeologist Indiana Jones must follow in his father's footsteps and stop the Nazis.
Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade

tomatoes.consensus: Lighter and more comedic than its predecessor, Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade returns the series to the brisk serial adventure of Raiders, while adding a dynamite double act between Harrison Ford and Sean Connery.

Lethal Weapon 2.plot: Riggs and Murtaugh are on the trail of South African diplomats who are using their immunity to engage in criminal activities.
Lethal Weapon 2.title: Lethal Weapon 2

tomatoes.consensus: Lethal Weapon 2 may sport a thin plot typical of action fare, but its combination of humor and adrenaline, along with the chemistry between its leads, make this a playful, entertaining sequel.

Look Who's Talking.plot: After a single, career-minded woman is left on her own to give birth to the child of a married man, she finds a new romantic chance in a cab driver. Meanwhile the point-of-view of the newborn boy is narrated through voice over.
Look Who's Talking.title: Look Who's Talking

Lock Up.plot: With only 6 months left of his prison sentence inmate Frank Leone is transferred from minimum security to maximum security by a vindictive warden.
Lock Up.title: Lock Up

Parenthood.plot: The Buckman family is a midwestern family all dealing with their lives: estranged relatives, raising children, pressures of the job, and learning to be a good parent and spouse.
Parenthood.title: Parenthood

tomatoes.consensus: Bolstered by a delightful cast, Parenthood is a funny and thoughtfully crafted look at the best and worst moments of family life that resonates broadly.

Say Anything....plot: A noble underachiever and a beautiful valedictorian fall in love the summer before she goes off to college.
Say Anything....title: Say Anything...

tomatoes.consensus: One of the definitive Generation X movies, Say Anything is equally funny and heartfelt -- and it established John Cusack as an icon for left-of-center types everywhere.

Star Trek V: The Final Frontier.plot: Captain Kirk and his crew must deal with Mr. Spock's long-lost half-brother who hijacks the Enterprise for an obsessive search for God at the center of the galaxy.
Star Trek V: The Final Frontier.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier

tomatoes.consensus: Filled with dull action sequences and an underdeveloped storyline, this fifth Trek movie is probably the worst of the series.

Valmont.plot: Set in Baroque France, a scheming widow and her lover make a bet regarding the corruption of a recently married woman. The lover, Valmont, bets that he can seduce her, even though she is an...
Valmont.title: Valmont

Vampire's Kiss.plot: After an encounter with a neck-biter, a publishing executive thinks that he's turning into a vampire.
Vampire's Kiss.title: Vampire's Kiss

The War of the Roses.plot: A married couple try everything to get each other to leave the house in a vicious divorce battle.
The War of the Roses.title: The War of the Roses

When Harry Met Sally....plot: Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship.
When Harry Met Sally....title: When Harry Met Sally...

tomatoes.consensus: Rob Reiner's touching, funny film set a new standard for romantic comedies, and he was ably abetted by the sharp interplay between Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan.

Sex, Lies, and Videotape.plot: A sexually repressed woman's husband is having an affair with her sister. The arrival of a visitor with a rather unusual fetish changes everything.
Sex, Lies, and Videotape.title: Sex, Lies, and Videotape

tomatoes.consensus: In his feature directorial debut, Steven Soderbergh demonstrates a mastery of his craft well beyond his years, pulling together an outstanding cast and an intelligent script for a nuanced, mature film about neurosis and human sexuality.

The Adventures of Ford Fairlane.plot: A vulgar private detective is hired to find a missing groupie and is drawn into a mystery involving a series of murders tied to the music industry.
The Adventures of Ford Fairlane.title: The Adventures of Ford Fairlane

Air America.plot: A young pilot finds himself recruited into a covert and corrupt CIA airlift organization operating in Vietnam War Era Laos.
Air America.title: Air America

Awakenings.plot: The victims of an encephalitis epidemic many years ago have been catatonic ever since, but now a new drug offers the prospect of reviving them.
Awakenings.title: Awakenings

Back to the Future Part III.plot: Enjoying a peaceable existence in 1885, Doctor Emmet Brown is about to be killed by Buford "Mad Dog" Tannen. Marty McFly travels back in time to save his friend.
Back to the Future Part III.title: Back to the Future Part III

Dances with Wolves.plot: Lt. John Dunbar, exiled to a remote western Civil War outpost, befriends wolves and Indians, making him an intolerable aberration in the military.
Dances with Wolves.title: Dances with Wolves

tomatoes.consensus: A grand, sweeping epic with inarguably noble intentions and arresting cinematography, but one whose center, arguably, is not as weighty as it should be.

Days of Thunder.plot: A young hot-shot stock car driver gets his chance to compete at the top level.
Days of Thunder.title: Days of Thunder

tomatoes.consensus: Days of Thunder has Tom Cruise and plenty of flash going for it, but they aren't enough to compensate for the stock plot, two-dimensional characters, and poorly written dialogue.

Darkman.plot: A brilliant scientist left for dead returns to exact revenge on the people who burned him alive.
Darkman.title: Darkman

Die Hard 2.plot: John McClane attempts to avert disaster as rogue military officials seize control of Dulles International Airport in Washington, D.C.
Die Hard 2.title: Die Hard 2

tomatoes.consensus: It lacks the fresh thrills of its predecessor, but Die Hard 2 still works as an over-the-top -- and reasonably taut -- big-budget sequel, with plenty of set pieces to paper over the plot deficiencies.

Edward Scissorhands.plot: A gentle man, with scissors for hands, is brought into a new community after living in isolation.
Edward Scissorhands.title: Edward Scissorhands

tomatoes.consensus: The first collaboration between Johnny Depp and Tim Burton, Edward Scissorhands is a magical modern fairy tale with gothic overtones and a sweet center.

Ghost.plot: After an accident leaves a young man dead, his spirit stays behind to warn his lover of impending danger, with the help of a reluctant psychic.
Ghost.title: Ghost

The Godfather: Part III.plot: In the midst of trying to legitimize his business dealings in New York and Italy in 1979, aging Mafia don Michael Corleone seeks to avow for his sins while taking a young protègè under his wing.
The Godfather: Part III.title: The Godfather: Part III

Goodfellas.plot: Henry Hill and his friends work their way up through the mob hierarchy.
Goodfellas.title: Goodfellas

tomatoes.consensus: Hard-hitting and stylish, GoodFellas is a gangster classic -- and arguably the high point of Martin Scorsese's career.

The Grifters.plot: A small-time conman has torn loyalties between his estranged mother and new girlfriend--both of whom are high-stakes grifters with their own angles to play.
The Grifters.title: The Grifters

Green Card.plot: A man wanting to stay in the US enters into a marriage of convenience, but it turns into more than that.
Green Card.title: Green Card

Hamlet.plot: Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, finds out that his uncle Claudius killed his father to obtain the throne, and plans revenge.
Hamlet.title: Hamlet

tomatoes.consensus: It may lack some of the depth and complexity of the play, but Mel Gibson and Franco Zeffirelli make a surprisingly successful team.

Home Alone.plot: An 8-year old troublemaker must protect his home from a pair of burglars when he is accidentally left home alone by his family during Christmas vacation.
Home Alone.title: Home Alone

The Hunt for Red October.plot: In 1984, the USSR's best submarine captain in their newest sub violates orders and heads for the USA. Is he trying to defect, or to start a war?
The Hunt for Red October.title: The Hunt for Red October

tomatoes.consensus: Perfectly cast and packed with suspense, The Hunt for Red October is an old-fashioned submarine thriller with plenty of firepower to spare.

Jacob's Ladder.plot: Mourning his dead child, a haunted Vietnam war veteran attempts to discover his past while suffering from a severe case of dissociation. To do so, he must decipher reality and life from his own dreams, delusion, and perception of death.
Jacob's Ladder.title: Jacob's Ladder

Kindergarten Cop.plot: A tough cop is given his most difficult assignment ever: to masquerade as a kindergarten teacher in order to find a drug dealer.
Kindergarten Cop.title: Kindergarten Cop

Life Is Sweet.plot: Just north of London live Wendy, Andy, and their twenty-something twins, Natalie and Nicola. Wendy clerks in a shop, leads aerobics at a primary school, jokes like a vaudevillian, agrees to...
Life Is Sweet.title: Life Is Sweet

Miller's Crossing.plot: Tom Regan, an advisor to a Prohibition-era crime boss, tries to keep the peace between warring mobs but gets caught in divided loyalties.
Miller's Crossing.title: Miller's Crossing

tomatoes.consensus: Though possibly more notable for its distinctive style than an airtight story, this Coen brothers take on the classic gangster flick features sharp dialogue, impressive cinematography, and a typically quirky cast of characters.

Mr. & Mrs. Bridge.plot: It's about a five member family. The father is a conservative and traditional person who directs the family. The mother is at home, she tries to hold together the family, while Mr. Bridge ...
Mr. & Mrs. Bridge.title: Mr. & Mrs. Bridge

La Femme Nikita.plot: Convicted felon Nikita, instead of going to jail, is given a new identity and trained, stylishly, as a top secret spy/assassin.
La Femme Nikita.title: La Femme Nikita

Postcards from the Edge.plot: Substance-addicted Hollywood actress Suzanne Vale is on the skids. After a spell at a detox centre her film company insists as a condition of continuing to employ her that she live with her...
Postcards from the Edge.title: Postcards from the Edge

Pretty Woman.plot: A man in a legal but hurtful business needs an escort for some social events, and hires a beautiful prostitute he meets... only to fall in love.
Pretty Woman.title: Pretty Woman

Problem Child.plot: A young boy is just short of a monster. He is adopted by a loving man and his wacky wife. The laughs keep coming as the boy pushes them to the limits.
Problem Child.title: Problem Child

tomatoes.consensus: Mean-spirited and hopelessly short on comic invention, Problem Child is a particularly unpleasant comedy, one that's loaded with manic scenery chewing and juvenile pranks.

Pump Up the Volume.plot: Mark runs a pirate radio station and causes an uproar when he speaks his mind and enthralls fellow teens.
Pump Up the Volume.title: Pump Up the Volume

Rocky V.plot: Reluctantly retired from boxing and back from riches to rags, Rocky takes on a new protege who betrays him; As the champ's son must adjust to his family's new life after bankruptcy.
Rocky V.title: Rocky V

Reversal of Fortune.plot: Wealthy Sunny von Bèlow lies brain-dead, husband Claus guilty of attempted murder; but he says he's innocent and hires Alan Dershowitz for his appeal.
Reversal of Fortune.title: Reversal of Fortune

Tremors.plot: Natives of a small isolated town defend themselves against strange underground creatures which are killing them one by one.
Tremors.title: Tremors

tomatoes.consensus: An affectionate throwback to 1950s creature features, Tremors reinvigorates its genre tropes with a finely balanced combination of horror and humor.

Total Recall.plot: When a man goes for virtual vacation memories of the planet Mars, an unexpected and harrowing series of events forces him to go to the planet for real, or does he?
Total Recall.title: Total Recall

tomatoes.consensus: Under Paul Verhoeven's frenetic direction, Total Recall is a fast-paced rush of violence, gore, and humor that never slacks.

The Unbelievable Truth.plot: After serving time for murder, Josh Hutton returns to his home town where me meets Audry Hugo. No one can remember exactly what Josh did, but they are all wary of him, especially Audry's ...
The Unbelievable Truth.title: The Unbelievable Truth

Wild at Heart.plot: Young lovers Sailor and Lula run from the variety of weirdos that Lula's mom has hired to kill Sailor.
Wild at Heart.title: Wild at Heart

Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!.plot: An unbalanced but alluring former mental patient takes a porn star prisoner in the hopes of convincing her to marry him.
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!.title: Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

Days of Being Wild.plot: Set in 1960, the film centres on the young, boyishly handsome Yuddy, who learns from the drunken ex-prostitute who raised him that she is not his real mother. Hoping to hold onto him, she ...
Days of Being Wild.title: Days of Being Wild

Backdraft.plot: Two Chicago firefighter brothers who don't get along have to work together while a dangerous arsonist is on the loose.
Backdraft.title: Backdraft

tomatoes.consensus: It's not particularly deep, but Backdraft is a strong action movie with exceptional special effects.

Barton Fink.plot: A renowned New York playwright is enticed to California to write for the movies and discovers the hellish truth of Hollywood.
Barton Fink.title: Barton Fink

tomatoes.consensus: Twisty and unsettling, the Coen brothers' satirical tale of a 1940s playwright struggling with writer's block is packed with their trademark sense of humor and terrific performances from its cast.

Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey.plot: A tyrant from the future creates evil android doubles of Bill and Ted and sends them back to eliminate the originals.
Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey.title: Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey

Boyz n the Hood.plot: Follows the lives of three young males living in the Crenshaw ghetto of Los Angeles, dissecting questions of race, relationships, violence and future prospects.
Boyz n the Hood.title: Boyz n the Hood

Cape Fear.plot: A convicted rapist, released from prison after serving a fourteen-year sentence, stalks the family of the lawyer who originally defended him.
Cape Fear.title: Cape Fear

tomatoes.consensus: Smart and stylish, Cape Fear is a gleefully mainstream shocker from Martin Scorsese, with a terrifying Robert De Niro peformance.

Class Action.plot: Jeb Ward is an attorney who specializes in whistle blower, David vs. Goliath, type cases. He finds a client who is suing an auto company over a safety problem that has had a severe effect ...
Class Action.title: Class Action

Dead Again.plot: An amnesiac and a private eye find they might have a past life connection.
Dead Again.title: Dead Again

Delicatessen.plot: Post-apocalyptic surrealist black comedy about the landlord of an apartment building who occasionally prepares a delicacy for his odd tenants.
Delicatessen.title: Delicatessen

tomatoes.consensus: Director Jean-Pierre Jeunet deftly combines horror, sci-fi, and humor in Delicatessen, a morbid comedy set in a visually ravishing futuristic dystopia.

The Doors.plot: The story of the famous and influential 1960s rock band and its lead singer and composer, Jim Morrison, from his days as a UCLA film student in Los Angeles, to his untimely death in Paris, France at age 27 in 1971.
The Doors.title: The Doors

tomatoes.consensus: Val Kilmer delivers a powerhouse performance as one of rock's most incendiary figures, but unfortunately, Oliver Stone is unable to shed much light on the circus surrounding the star.

Father of the Bride.plot: With his oldest daughter's wedding approaching, a father finds himself reluctant to let go.
Father of the Bride.title: Father of the Bride

tomatoes.consensus: While it doesn't quite hit the heights of the original, this remake of the 1950 classic is pleasantly enjoyable, thanks in large part to winning performances from Steve Martin and Martin Short.

The Fisher King.plot: A former radio DJ, suicidally despondent because of a terrible mistake he made, finds redemption in helping a deranged homeless man who was an unwitting victim of that mistake.
The Fisher King.title: The Fisher King

tomatoes.consensus: An odd but affecting mixture of drama, comedy and fantasy, The Fisher King manages to balance moving performances from Robin Williams and Jeff Bridges with director Terry Gilliam's typically askew universe.

Grand Canyon.plot: Grand Canyon revolved around six residents from different backgrounds whose lives intertwine in modern-day Los Angeles. At the center of the film is the unlikely friendship of two men from ...
Grand Canyon.title: Grand Canyon

Hook.plot: When Captain Hook kidnaps his children, an adult Peter Pan must return to Neverland and reclaim his youthful spirit in order to challenge his old enemy.
Hook.title: Hook

tomatoes.consensus: The look of Hook is lively indeed but Steven Spielberg directs on autopilot here, giving in too quickly to his sentimental, syrupy qualities.

Hudson Hawk.plot: A cat burglar is forced to steal Da Vinci works of art for a world domination plot.
Hudson Hawk.title: Hudson Hawk

JFK.plot: A New Orleans DA discovers there's more to the Kennedy assassination than the official story.
JFK.title: JFK

tomatoes.consensus: As history, Oliver Stone's JFK is dubious, but as filmmaking it's electric, cramming a ton of information and excitement into its three-hour runtime and making great use of its outstanding cast.

Naked Lunch.plot: After developing an addiction to the substance he uses to kill bugs, an exterminator accidentally murders his wife and becomes involved in a secret government plot being orchestrated by giant bugs in a port town in North Africa.
Naked Lunch.title: Naked Lunch

My Own Private Idaho.plot: Two best friends living on the streets of Portland as hustlers embark on a journey of self discovery and find their relationship stumbling along the way.
My Own Private Idaho.title: My Own Private Idaho

tomatoes.consensus: A tantalizing glimpse of a talented director and his stars all at the top of their respective games, Gus Van Sant's loose reworking of Henry IV is smart, sad and audacious.

Point Break.plot: An FBI agent goes undercover to catch a gang of bank robbers who may be surfers.
Point Break.title: Point Break

Slacker.plot: A day in the life of Austin, Texas as the camera roams from place to place and provides a brief look at the overeducated, the social misfits, the outcasts and the oddballs.
Slacker.title: Slacker

Sèlo con tu pareja.plot: Yuppie and womanizer Tomas is caught in a trap when falsely diagnosed with A.I.D.S. by Silvia, a nurse who finds herself cheated by the young Casanova. Looking for a quick death (putting ...
Sèlo con tu pareja.title: Sèlo con tu pareja

The Silence of the Lambs.plot: A young F.B.I. cadet must confide in an incarcerated and manipulative killer to receive his help on catching another serial killer who skins his victims.
The Silence of the Lambs.title: The Silence of the Lambs

tomatoes.consensus: Director Jonathan Demme's smart, taut thriller teeters on the edge between psychological study and all-out horror, and benefits greatly from stellar performances by Anthony Hopkins and Jodie Foster.

Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country.plot: On the eve of retirement, Kirk and McCoy are charged with assassinating the Klingon High Chancellor and imprisoned. The Enterprise crew must help them escape to thwart a conspiracy aimed at sabotaging the last best hope for peace.
Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country.title: Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country

tomatoes.consensus: The Undiscovered Country is a strong cinematic send-off for the original Trek crew, featuring some remarkable visuals and an intriguing, character-driven mystery plot.

High Heels.plot: A girl's mother returns after 15 years to find her daughter has married one of her (the mother's) old boyfriends. They try to mend their broken mother/daughter relationship and deal with ...
High Heels.title: High Heels

Terminator 2: Judgment Day.plot: A cyborg, identical to the one who failed to kill Sarah Connor, must now protect her young son, John Connor, from a more advanced cyborg, made out of liquid metal.
Terminator 2: Judgment Day.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day

tomatoes.consensus: T2 features thrilling action sequences and eye-popping visual effects, but what takes this sci-fi/ action landmark to the next level is the depth of the human (and cyborg) characters.

Thelma & Louise.plot: An Arkansas waitress and a housewife shoot a rapist and take off in a '66 Thunderbird.
Thelma & Louise.title: Thelma & Louise

tomatoes.consensus: Simultaneously funny, heartbreaking, and peppered with action, Ridley Scott's Thelma & Louise is a potent, well-acted road movie that transcends the feminist message at its core.

Truly Madly Deeply.plot: Once upon a time there were two people in love, their names were Nina and Jamie. They were even happy enough to be able to live happily ever after, (not often the case) and then Jamie died....
Truly Madly Deeply.title: Truly Madly Deeply

Trust.plot: When high school dropout Maria Coughlin announces her pregnancy to her parents, her father drops dead on the floor. Her mother kicks her out of the house and her boyfriend dumps her, so ...
Trust.title: Trust

What About Bob?.plot: A successful psychotherapist loses his mind after one of his most dependent patients, a manipulative, obsessively compulsive narcissist, tracks him down during his family vacation.
What About Bob?.title: What About Bob?

tomatoes.consensus: Bill Murray and Richard Dreyfuss' chemistry helps make the most of a familiar yet durable premise, elevating What About Bob? into the upper ranks of '90s comedies.

Alienè.plot: Ripley continues to be stalked by a savage alien, after her escape pod crashes on a prison planet.
Alienè.title: Alienè

American Me.plot: A Mexican-American Mafia kingpin is released from prison, falls in love for the first time, and grows introspective about his gangster lifestyle.
American Me.title: American Me

Bad Lieutenant.plot: While investigating a young nun's rape, a corrupt New York City police detective, with a serious drug and gambling addiction, tries to change his ways and find forgiveness.
Bad Lieutenant.title: Bad Lieutenant

Basic Instinct.plot: A police detective is in charge of the investigation of a brutal murder, in which a beautiful and seductive woman could be involved.
Basic Instinct.title: Basic Instinct

tomatoes.consensus: Unevenly echoing the work of Alfred Hitchcock, Basic Instinct contains a star-making performance from Sharon Stone but is ultimately undone by its problematic, overly lurid plot.

Boomerang.plot: A successful executive and womanizer finds his lifestyle choices have turned back on him when his new female boss turns out to be an even bigger deviant than he is.
Boomerang.title: Boomerang

Dead Alive.plot: A young man's mother is bitten by a Sumatran rat-monkey. She gets sick and dies, at which time she comes back to life, killing and eating dogs, nurses, friends, and neighbors.
Dead Alive.title: Dead Alive

tomatoes.website: http://for an abundance of outrageous gore
tomatoes.consensus: The delightfully gonzo tale of a lovestruck teen and his zombified mother, Dead Alive is extremely gory and exceedingly good fun, thanks to Peter Jackson's affection for the tastelessly sublime.

A Brief History of Time.plot: A film about the life and work of the cosmologist, Stephen Hawking, who despite his near total paralysis, is one of the great minds of all time.
A Brief History of Time.title: A Brief History of Time

Dracula.plot: The vampire comes to England to seduce a visitor's fiancèe and inflict havoc in the foreign land.
Dracula.title: Dracula

tomatoes.consensus: Overblown in the best sense of the word, Francis Ford Coppola's vision of Bram Stoker's Dracula rescues the character from decades of campy interpretations -- and features some terrific performances to boot.

Buffy the Vampire Slayer.plot: A flighty teenage girl learns that she is her generation's destined battler of vampires.
Buffy the Vampire Slayer.title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer

Rebels of the Neon God.plot: Defying his parents, Hsiao Kang drops out of the local crammer to head for the bright lights of downtown Taipei. He falls in with Ah Tze, a pretty hood and their relationships is a confused...
Rebels of the Neon God.title: Rebels of the Neon God

tomatoes.consensus: Rebels of the Neon God announces writer-director Ming-liang Tsai as a fully formed talent -- and remains one of the more accomplished debuts of the decade.

Cool World.plot: A comic strip vamp seeks to seduce her cartoonist creator in order to cross over into the real world.
Cool World.title: Cool World

tomatoes.consensus: Cool World throws a small handful of visual sparks, but they aren't enough to distract from the screenplay's thin characters and scattered plot.

Cronos.plot: A mysterious device designed to provide its owner with eternal life resurfaces after four hundred years, leaving a trail of destruction in its path.
Cronos.title: Cronos

tomatoes.consensus: Guillermo del Toro's unique feature debut is not only gory and stylish, but also charming and intelligent.

The Crying Game.plot: A British soldier is kidnapped by IRA terrorists. He befriends one of his captors, who is drawn into the soldier's world.
The Crying Game.title: The Crying Game

tomatoes.consensus: The Crying Game is famous for its shocking twist, but this thoughtful, haunting mystery grips the viewer from start to finish.

The Distinguished Gentleman.plot: A Florida con man uses the passing of the long time Congressman from his district who he just happens to share a name with, to get elected to his version of paradise, Congress, where the ...
The Distinguished Gentleman.title: The Distinguished Gentleman

Far and Away.plot: A young man leaves Ireland with his landlord's daughter after some trouble with her father, and they dream of owning land at the big give-away in Oklahoma ca. 1893. When they get to the new...
Far and Away.title: Far and Away

A Few Good Men.plot: Neo military lawyer Kaffee defends Marines accused of murder; they contend they were acting under orders.
A Few Good Men.title: A Few Good Men

tomatoes.consensus: An old-fashioned courtroom drama with a contemporary edge, A Few Good Men succeeds on the strength of its stars, with Tom Cruise, Demi Moore, and especially Jack Nicholson delivering powerful performances that more than compensate for the predictable plot.

Glengarry Glen Ross.plot: An examination of the machinations behind the scenes at a real estate office.
Glengarry Glen Ross.title: Glengarry Glen Ross

tomatoes.consensus: This adaptation of David Mamet's play is every bit as compelling and witty as its source material, thanks in large part to a clever script and a bevy of powerhouse actors.

Hoffa.plot: A film based on the story of legendary union figure Jimmy Hoffa.
Hoffa.title: Hoffa

Howards End.plot: A businessman thwarts his wife's bequest of an estate to another woman.
Howards End.title: Howards End

tomatoes.consensus: A superbly-mounted adaptation of E.M. Forster's tale of British class tension, with exceptional performances all round, Howard's End ranks among the best of Merchant-Ivory's work.

Johnny Suede.plot: A struggling young musician and devoted fan of Ricky Nelson wants to be just like his idol and become a rock star.
Johnny Suede.title: Johnny Suede

The Last of the Mohicans.plot: Three trappers protect a British Colonel's daughters in the midst of the French and Indian War.
The Last of the Mohicans.title: The Last of the Mohicans

A League of Their Own.plot: Two sisters join the first female professional baseball league and struggle to help it succeed amidst their own growing rivalry.
A League of Their Own.title: A League of Their Own

tomatoes.consensus: Sentimental and light, but still thoroughly charming, A League of Their Own is buoyed by solid performances from a wonderful cast.

Lethal Weapon 3.plot: Martin Riggs and Roger Murtaugh pursue an arms dealer who is a former LAPD officer.
Lethal Weapon 3.title: Lethal Weapon 3

The Long Day Closes.plot: The Long Day Closes is the story of eleven-year-old "Bud." A sad and lonely boy, Bud struggles through his days. With cinema as his main source of solace, he haunts the local movie-house. ...
The Long Day Closes.title: The Long Day Closes

Malcolm X.plot: Biographical epic of the controversial and influential Black Nationalist leader, from his early life and career as a small-time gangster, to his ministry as a member of the Nation of Islam.
Malcolm X.title: Malcolm X
